item.title: Tech Titans Declare War on Manners: "Please" and "Thank You" Costing Us Billions
item.description: In a groundbreaking press conference that left etiquette experts aghast, leading Silicon Valley CEOs announced a bold new initiative: the complete elimination of workplace pleasantries, which they claim are “crushing productivity” and “bleeding profits.” “Every ‘please’ and ’thank you’ is a microaggression against our bottom line,” declared Xander Blip, CEO of tech giant Nimbus AI, while aggressively mashing his keyboard for emphasis. “We’ve crunched the numbers, and it turns out that basic human decency is costing the tech sector approximately $4.
